bibl.title: English translation [from Spanish] of letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Philip Showalter Hench, June 23, 1952

div1.p: Rojas sends Hench photographs of the Camp Lazear work. She has heard that the mayor of Marianao is involved in the project.

div1.head: English translation [from Spanish] of letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Philip Showalter Hench, June 23, 1952 (See Spanish original.)
div1.opener:
June 23, 1952
Dr. Phillip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I hope that you have received my letter dated May 21, in which I gave
you the most recent information concerning Camp Lazear.

Now I am including photographs of the work which they are doing now.
According to what they have told me, the mayor of Marianno is interested
in the project and will construct the streets that give access to the
place.

Hoping that all are in good health and that you will not keep me waiting
so long without news from you, I greet you affectionately.
div1.closer:
Maria Teresa Rojas
P.S. Regards from Lydia and Julia for all of yours.
Translated by G. C. Harrison--dhn
6/27/52
